page.title: 12WILDLIFE 3
page.content: THE PONIES On the moor too are hundreds of Exmoor ponies and a grim fight is being made by the farmers to maintain the pure Exmoor strain. The whitish colouring around the muzzle and its wide chest make it immediately identifiable from all other ponies in the world. They average about 12 hands or so in height and are fine sturdy animals. They can often be seen wild on the moor and are rounded up prior to the Bampton Pony Fair held on the last Thursday in Ocober. TROUT Trout abound in the streems and there are also salmon.
